caseName: United States v. Huffman

recap_documents.description: ORDER AND RECOMMENDED DISPOSITION  as to Beverly Lockhart and Thad Ray Manning  1.  Dft Mannings Motion to Dismiss (D.E.  39 ) be, in part, GRANTED as to Counts I & II, and therefore Counts I & II of the Superseding Indictment (D.E.  8 ) be DISMISSED WITHOUT PREJUDICE.  Dft Mannings Motion to Dismiss Counts I & II on the basis of multiplicity (D.E.  39 ) be DENIED.  3. Dft Lockharts Motion to Dismiss (D.E.  58 ) be, in part, GRANTED as to Counts I & II, and therefore  Counts I and II of the Superseding Indictment (D.E.  8 ) be DISMISSED WITHOUT PREJUDICE.  4.  Dft Lockharts Motion to Dismiss Counts VI and VII for failure to state an offense (D.E.  58 ) be DENIED.  5. Dft Lockharts Motion to Dismiss C ounts I, II, IV, V, VI, and VII on the basis of multiplicity (D.E.  58 ) be DENIED.  The Court also ORDERS that Dft Mannings Motion for a Bill of Particulars (D.E.  38 ) is DENIED.  Court directs parties to 28 USC 636(b)(1) for appeal r ights concerning the recommendations above, issued under subsection (B) of that statute. As defined by section 636(b)(1) and F R Cr P  59(b), within fourteen days after being served with a copy of this Recommended Disposition, any party may serve and  file written objections to any or all portions for de novo consideration by the District Court. The parties should consult the aforementioned statute and rule for specific appeal rights and mechanics. Failure to object in accordance with Rule 59(b) waives a partys right to review. Objections to R&R due by 11/16/2012. Signed by Magistrate Judge Hanly A. Ingram on 10/29/12. (MJY)cc:  COR,USM,USP

recap_documents.description: MEMORANDUM DECISION AND ORDER.  The defendant's motion for summary judgment is granted as to all claims alleged in the amended complaint as well as to the defendant's counterclaims for breach of contract and specific performance. The defend ant's request for attorneys' fees is denied. The motion to seal the Agreement (ECF No. 30) is denied. The Clerk of Court is respectfully directed to enter judgment in favor of the defendant and close this action.  Ordered by Judge Ann M. Donnelly on 9/18/2020.  (Greene, Donna)
